results.title: Australian diary. No. 091
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The aeroplane is playing an important part in the Australian economy by transporting perishable goods and general supplies across the vast distances of the continent; grasshoppers are fighting a losing battle against the modern insecticide and the aeroplane; swamplands surrounding Pedbank Weir are attracting migratory birds in their thousands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 090
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Trainee air hostesses receive instruction in such subjects as care of children handling of emergency equipment; the arts of make-up and hairstyling; training of dogs to help police in the enforcement of law and order; how “Meals on Wheels”, a scheme founded and organized by Miss Doris Taylor, who was crippled, renders life easier for the aged and infirm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 087
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: at the Sydney Conservatorium of Music, a ballet, staged and created by a group of teenagers is performed and received enthusiastic praise from audiences; the making of whisky is shown requiring the skill of experts; hoops are used to provide children with a novel method of physical exercise.

results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a vital service is carried out by the Water Police in New South Wales; Grandpa’s pride and joy automobile is still full of pep; Darwin, gateway to the north of this vast continent, gets a new look.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 082
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: pipe bands are a traditional part of Scottish life and culture; the manufacture of chisels in Australian factories call for precision and ingenuity; the irrigation of dry areas is of national importance in Australia.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 081
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a look at some loveable dogs, some of whom can sing, talk and act; a new use has been found for Australian ti-tree - the bark is the raw material used for a revolutionary filling material for pillows, bedding and cushions; the Commonwealth Aircraft Corporation’s factory at Fishermen’s Bend, Melbourne is the birthplace of the Australian-built Rolls Royce Avon jet engine, the power behind the Sabre fighter and Canberra bomber.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 080
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: Alf White builds miniatures and inserts them into light bulbs; A portable transceiver is tested in field trials for use by the Australian Army; a centenarian ex-contortionist of 103 years demonstrates how he can still twist his body; map making is an intricate detailed job and the process used to convert aerial photographs into printed maps is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 079
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Pupils make it look easy at a Sydney acrobatic school perform routines developed for stage and film work. Adelaide woodcarver using Australian and exotic wood for his craft carves in 3-D. A report on the Rum Jungle where Robert Menzies opens a new treatment plant to make yellow cake for export from uranium ore mined at Rum Jungle.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 076
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: the fabulous wealth in Australia’s gold and copper mines is revealed; beach sand yields valuable metals; a preschool centre makes a charming study and an ancient fort is a home for old soldiers.
